description.narrative: Water supply and sanitation services are provided and sustained through gender sensitive, community management and community based (CLTS) approaches in 15 target districts by 2016

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Water supply and sanitation services are provided and sustained through gender sensitive, community management and community based (CLTS) approaches in 15 target districts by 2016

description.narrative: Over 300,000 people gained access to sanitation facilities in cholera hot-spots, fifteen thousand people had access to safe drinking water and over one million people, including over 50% children, lived in safer and cleaner environments free of faecal matter. | Status:Met | As-of Date:17/12/2018

UNICEF-targeted population in humanitarian situations accessing sufficient quantity of water of appropriate quality for drinking, cooking and personal hygiene
Number of sanitation marketing entrepreneurs (men & women) actively selling sanitation services
